loan.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is single and blessed with one child who is still in school. For the last six years, she has been operating a retail shop to make a living. She also runs a grocery to earn extra income. She employs one person to help her in the business.
In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. With a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy more fruits for resale.

loan.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida's primary source of income comes from raising hogs to breed and fatten for future sale. She has been raising hogs for almost five years. She usually earns an income of P2,000 for each hog she is able to sell. Zenaida sells her hogs to the butchers who come into her village.
As of now, Zenaida has four pigs to raise. She is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines to ensure proper growth and nutrition. She wants to improve her hog selling business.
In the future, Zenaida would like to enhance her business in order to earn enough money for the college education of her only child.

loan.use: to buy hog feed, medicines, and vaccines.

loan.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala (in the photo) is 36 years old and her husband, Ratha, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have four children, three sons and one daughter, who are in school. The daughter just finished her baccalaureate degree and she is now in her first year of university. The family is living in a village on National Road Number 2, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Mala is a hair dresser; she runs her own hairdressing shop at home. Her husband has full-time employment. Mala is asking for her first Kiva loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to her university classes.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to school.

loan.name: Zephanus

texts.en: Zephanus is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a retailer of new clothes for women and children for three years; before that, he sold household utensils. His hardship is the seasonal nature of the product. His vision is to become a wholesaler and to educate his children. Zephanus needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loan.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Adija

texts.en: Adija is a determined businesswoman. Twenty-eight years old, she is single and blessed with two children. She has been selling skins and hides for the last five years to make a living. Previously, she sold handbags. Adija has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to become the distributor of the skins and hides in her region. With the loan she has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy hides and skin for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loan.use: to buy hides and skin.

loan.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Koeun (pictured here), 66, is a security guard. His wife, Phany, 56, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 1972 and have four children--two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are married; two live in a separate home, one still lives in the family home and another is a garment worker. The family is living in a village along National Road Number Three, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Koeun is in the process of building a new house, but has not yet finished it. Koeun has decided to ask for his first loan of $1,200 to complete the construction.

loan.use: to finish building his house.

loan.name: John

texts.en: John is a 47-year-old hardworking man married with eight children living in Fort Portal. He has a semi-permanent house and his dream is to educate all his children, construct a permanent house and expand his farm. He has been in the business of mixed farming for the last 10 years. He started with family labor and managed to mobilize money and buy a motorcycle and cows. He has been challenged by expensive labor and the weather changes. John needs the loan to buy sprays for tomatoes and green peppers and cattle.

loan.use: to buy cattle and spray for his tomatoes and green peppers

loan.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia wants a loan to buy sugar and braids to resell. She is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in her own house in Masindi, Uganda. She has been operating a retail shop for the last three years and her dream is to have a wholesale shop and educate her children.

loan.use: to buy sugar and braids to resell.

loan.name: Lakena

texts.en:
Lakena (pictured here) is 37 years old and her husband, Sophal, is 39 years old. They have been married since 2005 and have two young sons. They live in a village outside of Phnom Penh City.
Lakena and her husband are garment workers. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to put an addition on her house.

loan.use: To put an addition on her house.

loan.name: Cristobal

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Cristobal is engaged in vegetable production in their village to generate income. He is 30 years old and still single. He mentioned that he needs to prepare his future before he gets married, because he knows that having a family is a great responsibility. At this time, he is also helping his parents to finance the education of his younger brothers and sisters.
He is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his vegetable production. He believes that through this loan, he can raise more varieties of vegetables to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will become financially stable.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
Marilou has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconuts & bananas to sell.
Marilou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy coconuts & bananas to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy new clothes to resell

loan.name: Pariken

texts.en:
Pariken is 31 years old, married and a father to two children. He has been a maize and wheat farmer for the past three years.
Pariken has repaid his previous loan well and has now applied for his fourth loan with KADET Ltd. He will use the money to buy farm supplies such as pesticides and seedlings and to pay for labor. Pariken plans to use any profits generated from this loan to pay his children's school fees and to reinvest the rest in his farming business.
Pariken dreams of becoming a well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more, notwithstanding his limited resources.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies

loan.name: Nare

texts.en:
Nare is now a widow because her husband just passed away due to a traffic accident. She has five sons: three attend school, one is a garment factory worker and one is still young. The family lives about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
Nare is a garment worker. She is applying for another loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work. She will also use a part of the loan to put an additional on her house.

loan.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 26 years old, lives in Masindi, Uganda. She buys and sells secondhand clothes, a business she has operated ever since she dropped out of school. Josephine wants a loan to pay for her children's school fees. She wants to see her children attain degrees as minimum qualifications. Her desire is a boutique in a busy town.

loan.use: to pay her children's school fees

loan.name: Zita

texts.en: Zita is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. Zita has operated a shop for 5 years, selling firewood. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy firewood to sell. Zita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Zita hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy firewood to sell

loan.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 59 years old, is married and has six children, four of them still attending school. She enjoys selling grocery items such as milk, coffee, sugar and biscuits in her store. She has been operating her business for almost six years. Her daily profit of PHP 200 is used for daily meals and as revolving capital in her store. Violeta needs to replenish each item sold by the end of the week to keep generating income and meet all of her customers' needs.
Violeta is now asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, breads, eggs, detergent and soap to sell in her store. These additional items would help improve her sales. In the future, Violeta wants to save enough money to continuously finance her children's schooling.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, breads, eggs, detergent and soap to sell in her store

loan.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells fresh foods in Masindi, Uganda. She is a 28-year-old married woman with two children. She dreams of educating her children and owning a big food stall. Grace intends to use the loan facility to buy oranges and pineapples to sell.

loan.use: to buy oranges and pineapples to sell.

loan.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is married and blessed with three children. For the last year, he has been selling cows and goats to make a living. He also does farming to earn extra income. He has employed one person to help him to manage the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving. He has also improved his business with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya. With 40,000 Kenya, he wants to buy cows and goats for resale.

loan.use: To buy cows and goats

loan.name: Rutshele

texts.en:
Rutshele is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Rutshele has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Rutshele has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rutshele hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase fishing materials, such as cast nets, lines, poles and hooks.

loan.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a college graduate but due to the lack of job opportunities, he is engaged in hog raising to generate income. He aims to earn and save more income for his future and to help his parents to finance the education of his younger sister. He plans to raise more pigs so that he can earn more income when he sells them.
He wants to ask for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that through this loan, he can work out his plan. In the future, he hopes that he can make the business grow as he continues to work hard and strive for it.

loan.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Bitnong Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is a farmer in Litein South Rift Kenya. He is 36 and married with four children between 12 and 4 years old. He has been in dairy farming for 12 years and currently employs one farmhand who helps him produce tea and milk for the local market.
Festus has requested a loan of 52,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says dairy farming has a better future and the acquisition of the additional income will help earn him more income and improve the living standards of his family. He hopes his investment will double in five years.
Festus says lack of an organized market and bad weather conditions are the challenges they face as farmers.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Luzvina

texts.en:
Luzvina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children.
Luzvina has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas & coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.
Luzvina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Luzvina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy bananas & coconuts to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to buy soap, sugar and boxes of matches to sell.

loan.name: Presca

texts.en:
Presca is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Presca has a vegetable garden where she harvests & then sells vegetables or spices like ginger & eggplants. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.
Presca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Presca hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase assorted stock.

loan.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 61 years old, widowed and has five children. Two of them attend school. She had never experienced having a good employment so she devotes herself to a business of selling grocery items. She established a sari-sari (variety) store 10 years ago. But unluckily her store did not accumulate enough income. She decided to shift her store into hog raising business. In hog raising she usually earns an income of P2,000 for each hog she is able to dispose of. Income generated from the business is just enough to sustain their needs especially for daily allowances for her children.
She needs to enhance her business, that is why she is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy two additional hogs to raise, pig feed and medicines to ensure proper growth and nutrition of her hogs.
In the future, she wants to continue growing as a successful entrepreneur and lift her family out of poverty.

loan.use: to buy two additional hogs to raise, pig feed and medicines.

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 22 years old, married, and has three children. She is a hardworking businesswoman who has been selling clothing to earn a living. She has been in this business for the past year.
Beatrice is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more trousers and shirts to sell. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Beatrice dreams of buying a piece of land.

loan.use: to purchase trousers and skirts.

loan.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Anecita has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & vegetables for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices. Anecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables & spices

loan.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, aged 41, is a farmer and father of four aged between 19 and 8 years. He lives with the family in their hometown of Litein South Rift Kenya. He has been in mixed farming for 10 years producing tea, milk and eggs for the local markets. Robert has made a loan request of 52,000 KES from Kiva parter Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to educate his four children who are all currently in schoo,l as well as to repay the loan. He says there are prospects for business growth despite fluctuations in market prices especially for milk.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. She has had a shop that sells clothes like blouses & t-shirts for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy clothes to sell. Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Helen hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy clothes like shirts & blouses to sell

loan.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia, 53, is a resident of Dasmarias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nonito, a salesman, and has three children. Together they manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Eufemia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also sells cooked meat for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will use it to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.
Eufemia hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her store.

loan.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Elma has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Alejandra has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Alejandra has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Alejandra hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is single and age 23. For the last two years, he has been cutting and selling timber to earn a living. Paul has employed one person to help him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business.
With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), Paul wants to buy a power saw for his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loan.use: To buy a power saw.

loan.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Alicia, Isabela. She is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Leticia raises livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month.
She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services so that she could improve her living situation. Leticia is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP that she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support the immediate members of her family.

loan.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loan.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a responsible father who raised his family in a village, while planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops for sale. He is now 36 years old and has four school-age children. He aims to uplift their standard of living and give his family a better life. He aims to plant more vegetables and root crops to earn a higher income and satisfy their needs. He and his wife plan to continue sending their children to school, for they want them to become professionals in the future. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to support the education of their children.
Due to financial difficulty, he wants to ask an additional capital of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and seedlings, and to pay labor costs required in planting root crops. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will make the business grow and achieve his goals in life.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings, and to pay labor costs required in planting root crops.

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Babylyn

texts.en:
Babylyn Lucero is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Babylyn is married and has two children. To make a living, Babylyn owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month for these activities.
At this time, Babylyn is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of groceries and daily use products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and daily-use products to sell.

loan.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is from the village of Sto. Domingo. She is 34-years-old and is married with two children.
Winnie owns and operates a business raising and fattening pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.
Winnie is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase pigs, feed and other supplies.

loan.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 25-years-old, married and now blessed with two children. She was not given an opportunity to enter into college and have employment so she entered into an early marriage.
To generate an income, her spouse works as a local farmer and she also operates a retail business in the village where her family lives. Each month the couple earns an income of P6,000 and use it for their electric bills, vitamins for her children and for their daily meals.
She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugars, milk and coffee to sell in her store. She wants to sell more items in her store to acquire more profit from it.
In the future, she wants to make her small store grow into bigger one and someday improve their living condition.

loan.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugars, milk and coffee to sell in her store.

loan.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 46 -years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.
Marites has a shop that sells home products such as foams & bedding. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of home products like foams & beddings.
Marites has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marites hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of home products like foams & bedding.

loan.name: Turdiali

texts.en: Turdiali has been involved in business for many years. He is an experienced farmer. He is involved in growing agricultural crops. Working on land is a hard labor that requires a lot of effort and funds to buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. Turdiali wants to obtain this loan to plant winter crops and gather his harvest. Currently, Turdiali is teaching the farming business to his sons. He knows that the land will always provide a good harvest if you work hard enough.

loan.use: to plant winter crops and gather the harvest

loan.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Mirriam is 46-years-old. She manages a business raising hogs and her husband also works as a farmer in the village where they are living. She believes her work is one way to help provide for their daily needs.
Mirriam is requesting a 15,000 PHP a loan to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. She looks forward to the growth of her business.

loan.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs.

loan.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 39-years-old. She is married and has three children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loan.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with seven children.
Virgilio has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Virgilio has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virgilio hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mr. Saom, 48, is a resident of the Ornlong long Veng district of Siem Reap province. He is married with nine children. One of them has started a new family and lives away.
Mr. Saom works independently as a construction supervisor. He has about ten workers who work under his control. He usually earns about $5 USD per day through this business. Due to the lack of construction supplies, Mr. Saom has met many difficulties in running this business smoothly. With his first loan from HKL and Kiva, He will use to buy some construction materials such as a plane machine, an alternator, and other needed tools for construction work.
This loan will help him produce productive results and cut down the time or effort at the work place. He is grateful to all Kivas lenders who generously help his family in need.

loan.use: to buy construction materials, such as a plane machine, an alternator, and other needed tools.

loan.name: Muema

texts.en:
Muema is a married man, age 39. He has three children, all of whom attend school. He has been selling clothes for the last eleven years to make a living. He also operate a motorbike transport business to increase his income. He has employed one person to help him to run the business.
Muema has been able to retain his business because of good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more clothes for resale.

loan.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loan.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Tomasa has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Tomasa has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Tomasa hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Deoflor

texts.en:
Deoflor is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
Deoflor has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.
Deoflor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Deoflor hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Murodali

texts.en: Murodali is married and has one daughter. In the rural area, growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle and small livestock are the primary types of business. Murodali and his wife are involved in this type of business. He wants to buy several heads of cattle for fattening up over the winter and subsequent resale. He hopes to obtain this loan and earn a good income by expanding his business.

loan.use: to buy cattle

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
Christine provides motorcycle or habal-habal services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for this service.
Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loan.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar is a 45-year-old educated lady. She completed her education till 8th standard and couldnt study further due to financial constraints. She is involved in a business making Paranday (an ornament used to tie hair back) and elastics. Her Paranday are very famous among her customers and she makes good sales every month.
She is a mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is involved in a garment-selling business while her younger son doesnt do anything. Her elder daughter does sewing works and other two dont do anything.
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder sons business. With the loan, he will buy childrens' and ladies' garments in bulk to stock his shop for increasing his sales. Parveen is hopeful that with the loan investment, her son will be able to improve the financial condition of his business.

loan.use: To buy childrens' and ladies' garments for selling.

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Lorna has a shop that sells vegetables, spices, and dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of vegetables and dried fish to sell. Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy stocks of vegetables and dried fish to sell.

loan.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is an elderly lady aged 66. She has seven children above the age of 23 and she is widowed. She owns semi-permanent rental houses which earn her a living. She has been renting out these houses for five years. Besides this, she farms to supplement her income. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans which she has used to boost her business. Jacinta hopes to build permanent rental houses in five years. She has requested for 65,000 Kenya shillings to renovate the rental houses.

loan.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loan.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been in the farming business for 10 years in Litein which is an area of South Rift Kenya. He lives with his family of six children aged between 22 and 3 years with the last four still in school. His farm produces milk and tea for the local market.
Benard has requested for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter for preparing dairy feeds in his farm. He says this will ease the workload and make the feeding of the cows better which will ultimately improve his milk output. He adds that the business will become much better in future. However, he also says that markets need to be improved to help farmers get value for their investments. He believes he will have the means to provide basic needs for his family.

loan.use: To buy a chaff cutter for the dairy farm.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages .

loan.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario patiently sells clothes, shoes, and slippers to the people in her village. She has been doing this for almost five years. She buys the clothes at the market and sells them in the village where they live. In this kind of business she earns an income of P2,000 each month.
Rosario is now 48 years old and has five children. Two of her children attend school. The rest were engaged into early marriages and they sometimes run to help her in times of need.
She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. In the future, she wants to keep making better sales and make her family more economically stable.

loan.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loan.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
With his hard work and perseverance to uplift their living, Jimmy is doing his best to obtain it. He is 45 years old and married with three children. Jimmy is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. With his determination to quickly respond to the needs of his family, Jimmy also plants and harvests vegetables to sell.
Jimmy has already experienced difficulties in life during his childhood. He doesnt want his children to experience the same difficulties. He doesnt want them to starve, thats why he works hard to give them a quality life. Jimmy wishes to send his children to school until college and finish their education. He doesnt want his children to be like him and not be given a chance to enter college or even high school.
With regards to his farming business, Jimmy is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides that he will use in rice farming. He believes that the loan will have a positive impact on his farming because he is now able to buy the exact inputs needed for farming.

loan.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loan.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
Edwin has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Edwin has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Edwin hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loan.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 23 years old, single and hard working. He distributes bread in the retail shops in Tala.
He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy crates and repair his bicycle.
He will save some of the anticipated profits and use some for his daily basic needs.

loan.use: to buy crates,and repair his bicycle

loan.name: Rauf

texts.en: Rauf is married and has two children. He is involved in animal husbandry and growing potatoes. During the period of his entrepreneurship, he expanded his business and now earns a good income. Rauf is a hard-working person, and this quality helps him to be involved in several types of agricultural activities. He wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of three heads of livestock and then use the profits to pay for his son's education. He hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance.

loan.use: to buy livestock

loan.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years-old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
Roberto is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 11,000 in order to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.
Roberto has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Roberto hopes to improve his business.

loan.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loan.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is a diligent mother. She works as a full time Barangay Health Worker. To increase her earnings, she works part time direct selling cosmetics such as make up, colognes and perfumes to the people in her village. Through the profits earned from this business, she was able to continuously send her child to school. She has four children but only one of them got the opportunity to study, the rest have their own family.
Avelina is now 56 years-old and she is asking for a loan amount of P15,000 in order to buy additional items to sell such as lotion, colognes, perfume, lipsticks and shampoo.
In the future, she wants to improve her sales and earn enough income for the college education of her child.

loan.use: to buy lotion, colognes, perfume, lipsticks and shampoo to sell.

loan.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 49 years-old and married with three children. To earn a living, she provides veterinary services. She has employed eight people to assist her in the business. She also does dairy farming to earn extra income. Since she joined Kiva partner Faulu Kenya, she has learnt how to save her money. Mary hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested a loan of 100, 000 Kenya shillings in order to buy a dairy cow.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 31 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
Angelie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Angelie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Angelie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
Virginia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Virginia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy trousers, shirts, etc. to sell.

loan.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is 35 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.
Adelyn has a rice field that harvests and sells rice grains. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy fertilizers for the rice field.
Adelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Adelyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

loan.name: Astghik

texts.en: Astghik was born in 1962 in the Gegharkuniq village. She has a higher education and graduated from the Yerevan State University with a geology major. Astghik got married in 1985 and now lives with her husband and children in the town of Kapan. She has a son and a daughter. Her son is twenty years old, and he is studying part-time in his third year of the jurist division of the Yerevan State University. Astghik's daughter is twenty-five years old, she has a higher education, but does not work. Since 2003, Astghik has been working for a government organization, focused on preserving historical monuments of the Syunik province. Her husband works as an operative for the Syunik area police. Astghik is also involved in agriculture in the Achanan village, where she grows vegetables, fruits and nuts. She sells vegetables and fruits at a market and has loyal customers and distributors in Kapan. Profits from the agricultural business help Astghik to pay for her son's education and eases dealing with family expenses. She needs a loan in the sum of 300,000 Armenian dram to purchase seedlings of new potato varieties, which will allow Astghik to improve her income from sales of agricultural products.

loan.use: To purchase seedlings of new potato varieties

loan.name: Merlita

texts.en:
This is Merlita, 37 years-old and a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dante, a cook, and mother to their three children. Two have their own family while the youngest is still under her supervision. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her childs schooling.
Merlita oversees operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of a Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 385 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
Merlita dreams to be able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business.. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loan.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle lives in the barrio together with her husband and two young children. Her spouse works as 10-wheeler driver. To supplement their income, she established a retail store selling grocery items such as milk, sugar, canned goods and biscuits to the people in the barrio. She had been operating this for almost five years.
She wants to increase her earnings so she needs to stock more items in her store. She is now asking for a loan of P15,000 in order to buy instant noodles, canned goods, beverages and soap to sell in her store.
In the future, she wants to keep making better sales and someday achieve financial stability.

loan.use: to buy instant noodles, canned goods, beverages and soap to sell in her store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loan.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is 23 years old and still single. He is striving to finish college. Rolando is the youngest of his parents' five children. Rolandos father died 10 years ago. Rolando felt compassion for his mother's situation, which is why he is studying. He helps his mother with the farming activities during the weekend. Sometimes his older brothers and sister financially support him in pursuing his education.

Rolando manages the family's rice farming business. He has requested a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides. Rolando knows that the loan will be a big help for him to sustain his farming needs. Rolando wishes to finish his education and be able to extend his support to his mother.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides.

loan.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 25 years old, is married and has 2 children. She lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mary Ann has been farmng for 8 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 1,200. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm. Mary Ann has been a member of GDMPC for 1 year. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business so that she can give moral support to her children.

loan.use: to purchase additional fertilizers for her farm

loan.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 36-year-old businessman who sells clothes. He has been in business for over five years and has employed two people. He has created a good relationship with his customers and this has helped him to retain his customers in a very competitive business environment. Simon also runs a taxi business to earn extra income.

Simon hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He wants to start motorbike transport business; therefore, he has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a motorbike.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike

loan.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Vilma has operated a shop for 10 years, selling canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Vilma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future,Vilma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loan.name: Yegon

texts.en:
Yegon, 28 is a father of 2 children aged 5 and 2. He has been in farming for 9 years producing and selling milk, tea and eggs for the local market. He deals in tea both from his farm and and one sourced from other farmers in the local market.
Yegon has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase more poultry to boost his poutry business. He says that having been in the business for a while has given him the experience that would help him make the best out of the loan and gain income to provide for the basic needs of his young family. He remains optimistic about the business. Yegon however laments the fluctuating market prices.

loan.use: To purchase poultry

loan.name: Delima Manis Group

texts.en: Armah is 47 years old and a widow. She is standing in the front wearing a brown head scarf. She is a mother of five and grandmother of two. Two of her children are still in high school. She began her catering business in 2010 to have enough additional income to support her family and keep her children in school. This is her third loan with VisionFund Indonesia. The business has been doing well but she needs to increase her customer base. By taking out this loan, she can buy more ingredients to cook a larger variety of food and hopefully attract more customers. Her hope for her family is that her children can attend university, because she was only educated through middle school. Some of the other group members plan to use their loans for selling vegetables, selling clothes on credit, and selling nasi uduk (Indonesian rice).

loan.use: to pay for more ingredients to sell a larger variety of food

loan.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, 46, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Cleto, a jeepney driver, and the mother to their four children. Three of them are already working while the other one is in high school. By the grace of God, Rosana has managed to support her child's schooling. Rosana is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Rosana oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and parts for their jeepney and also to buy some equipment in their repair shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Rosana dreams that her child will finish her education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
---Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a flexible person. Aside from raising hogs, she is also a food vendor. She cooks and sells food products such as glutinous rice desserts. She offers it house-to-house to the people in the village where they live. She has been doing it for almost three years. She earns approximately P2,000 each month.
She is now requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour for her food selling business. In the future, she wants to establish a food stall so that she will no longer offer her products house-to-house.

loan.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk and flour for her food selling business.

loan.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is 28 years of age, and even at her young age she has been able to operate her store for four years. She is married and has two children. The couple work hard to sustain their daily needs and household expenses.
Petra aims to improve her store because she wants her children to finish their studies. With her strong determination in life, she wakes up early everyday to provide the needs of her costumer. She would like to stock her store because her merchandise sells out immediately. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amount of P7,000. She hopes that through this loan she can increase her sales which will enable her to support her children until they finish their degree courses.

loan.use: to purchase stock groceries for her store.

loan.name: Beyoglan

texts.ru: Beyoglan ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzili qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Beyoglan 22 qoda. On uje 2 qoda kak imeyet eto kafe. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svayego kafe chtobi on mog obslujivat bolshe kliyentov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje imeyet svayo kafe uje 11 let. Beyoglan okonchil shkolu i ushel v armiyu i kak vernulsya s armii nachal rabotat chtobi soderjat sebya i pomogat svoyey semye.
texts.en: Beyoglan is not married and does not have children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzili and now lives in the Makhmudlu village of the Fuzili region with his family. Beyoglan is 22 years old. He has had this cafe for two years. Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy tables and chairs for his cafe, so that he could serve more customers. Beyoglan learned this business from his uncle, who has had his own cafe for 11 years. Beyoglan finished school and went to the army, and started working right after returning from the army in order to provide for himself and help his family.

loan.use: to buy tables and chairs for his cafe

loan.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 47 years old and married. He is blessed with three children who are in school. His wife is a housekeeper. Romeo is a farmer, planting rice in the Philippines. He has been doing this business for 27 years. He usually earns an average income of P25,000 each crop. Sometimes his earnings depend on climate. It also depends on the seed variety he plants. Romeos habit is planting an inbred variety of rice because of its low cost. He has not enough capital to buy hybrid rice seed varieties because its costly.
Romeo desires to have a high yield and earn a higher income with every crop. He plans to plant hybrid rice seeds in order to obtain his desires. This situation leads him to request a loan of P27,000 to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides. Romeo is looking towards the success of his rice farming business.

loan.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides.

loan.name: Kiprono

texts.en:
Kiprono is aged 27 and is a farmer in his hometown of Litein in South Rift, Kenya. He is married with one child, aged 2, and has been farming for 4 years. With his current farm, he is producing tea and milk for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business for additional income to that of farming.
Kiprono has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase birds for a poultry venture. He says the market is not fully exploited, which is his motivation, coupled with the need to spread his farming risk.
He mentions the lack of animal feeds as a challenge in farming, but is glad Juhudi Kilimo is supporting farmers.

loan.use: To purchase poultry.

loan.name: Aqil

texts.en: Aqil is 39 years old and has been married for many years. He has two children who are school-aged. Aqil sells shoes and mens clothes. He started this business in 2001, in order to be able to improve his income. He works every day selling shoes to his neighbors and other clients. Aqil wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1500 AZN for the purchase of shoes in order to expand his business. This is his second loan from AqroInvest and he hopes that this loan will help his business progress and increase his earnings. He wants to thank you in advance for your support.

loan.use: to buy new products for his store

loan.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been a farmer for the last eleven years. He is 34 years old and married to a lady who is a housewife. They are blessed with three children.
He learned about KADET from marketing done by KADET staff in his "area of abode" (living area). This is his second loan which he plans to use to purchase farm supplies and to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.
His dream is to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well with enough funding.

loan.use: to purchase farm supplies

loan.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 27 years old and is married. He has three young children. To make a living, he sells fruits, vegetables and ice cream to people in the village where he lives together with his wife. He is now asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more ice cream, bananas, tomatoes and cabbages to sell. He would like to improve his sales.
In the future, he would like to keep making better sales to save for the education of his children.

loan.use: to buy more ice cream, bananas, tomatoes and cabbages to sell

loan.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto has owned a furniture shop for almost ten years. He is 56 years old, married and has been blessed with five children. He is grateful because all his five children are working already. Two of his children are OFW [Overseas Filipino Workers] while the three left are busy managing their rice fields.
Ernesto would like to improve their living conditions, so he is asking for additional capital of 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will enable him to make his business more profitable. He will improve the quality of his finished products so that many customer will patronize his products. He believes that he can make his dream come true through his patience and hard work.

loan.use: to purchase more woods and varnish for a furniture business

loan.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo lives peacefully with his family in their village. He has three school-aged children. Reynaldo is proud of being a farmer. He plants rice in the Philippines. He has been in this business for almost 26 years.
Reynaldos business serves him as a source of income. His profit from the business mostly goes for his children's fees in school and household expenses. Reynaldo has difficulties in providing farm inputs needed in rice farming because his priority is his children's education.
Renaldo is asking for a loan of P27,000 to buy rice seed, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for plant care. He wishes to get a better yield and gain higher income to supplement his family's needs.

loan.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides for plant care.

loan.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. To earn a living, he runs a 'posho' (cornmeal) mill. He has been in the business for three years. He also sells cereals in the same business premises. He has created a good relationship with his customers. This has helped him to retain his customers in a very competitive business environment. Previously, he was employed as a driver.
John hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loan.use: To buy cereals.

loan.name: Djalal

texts.ru: Djalal yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka kotoriy rodilsya nedavno. Djalal 23 qoda. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit lekarstvo dlya prodaji. Uje 3 qoda kak on imeyet etu apteku v kotoroy sam je i rabotayet.
texts.en: Djalal is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family. He is married and has one child, who was recently born. Djalal is 23 years old. Currently, he needs 2000 AZN to buy medicines for sale. Djalal has owned this pharmacy for three years and also works there.

loan.use: to purchase medicines for sale

loan.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 39 years old, married and has two children. He has been selling shoes and bags to earn a living. He began by selling shoes only. Later on, he started selling clothes. Through Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented. This is because he has gained a lot of knowledge about business management through the training sessions conducted by Faulu Kenya.
Gideon hopes to grow his business in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his business premises.

loan.use: To renovate his business premises.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 33 and married with six children aged between 14 and one year. He is a resident and a farmer in Kitale, western Kenya, where he lives with his family. He has been in farming for over six years, producing maize and beans for the local market. He also operates a taxi business within the area for additional income besides that of farming.
David has requested a fourth loan of 90,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to help him purchase poultry birds for 30,000 KES and use the remaining 60,000 KES to put up a greenhouse for growing tomatoes. He says Juhudi Kilimo loans have been of great help providing income that enables him to educate his children. He aspires to be a dairy breeder in future.
He however laments poor prices for farming output, considering high input costs.

loan.use: To purchase poultry birds and build a greenhouse.

loan.name: Elgun

texts.ru: Elgun 27 let. On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Elgun yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione posolok Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so svoyey jenoy i mamoy. Elgun uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en: Elgun is 27 years old. He is married, but does not have children. Elgun is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bala Bakhmanli village of the Fuzuli region together with his wife and mother. Elgun has been involved in animal husbandry for four years and breeds cattle. He currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle.

loan.use: to buy cattle

loan.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is an embroidery expert and does decorative embroidery for her community clients. She also sells clothes to them which she purchases from different cities.
She is married and her husband is an animal seller. He has some animals like buffaloes and goats which he sells after raising them to butchers and also sells their milk to his community clients.
Bashiraan is the mother of an 18-year-old daughter who is studying in intermediate and also learning embroidery from her mother. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will buy some animals for improving his business.
He has been operating his business for the past six years and Bashiraan is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business that will help her family to improve their living standard.

loan.use: To buy animals for her husband's animal sales business.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Janet is a 48-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 12 years to 22 years. She describes herself as patient, ambitious, and polite. She operates a poultry farming business; she sells chickens to her customers. She has been involved in this business for eight years.
Her business is located in a busy shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonality and disease outbreaks which could kill the chickens leading to high losses. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to grow her business and become the major supplier in Kakamega within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loan.use: To buy chickens.

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child. He runs a greengrocery so as to earn a living for his family. He has been running the business for five years. He also does farming to supplement his income. He was able to start the grocery business after getting financial support from Faulu Kenya.
Paul hopes to build rental houses in the future. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of onion, tomatoes and carrots.

loan.use: To add stock of onions, tomatoes and carrots.

loan.name: Valichon

texts.en: Valichon is a responsible and hard-working person. He is married and has two children. Valichon is involved in animal husbandry and has experience in this business. He owns 10 heads of cattle and 3 heads of small livestock. His wife helps him in this business. Valichon is a caring father and because he wants to raise his children in good conditions, he is also involved in growing agricultural crops, such as onions, carrots and cucumbers. This business also yields an additional profit. Valichon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 9500 somoni for the purchase of livestock, and this sum will help him to expand his business.

loan.use: to buy livestock

loan.name: Mutiru

texts.en:
Mutiru is a 43-year-old single woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 16 years to 20 years. She describes herself as social. She operates a tailoring services business where she makes and sells dresses, shirts, trousers and others. She has been involved in this business for 18 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre at Mwingi.
Mutiru describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of materials. Her business goal is to grow her business into a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to provide university education for her children.

loan.use: To buy materials for sewing.

loan.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he does photography. He has been in the business for five years. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused in his business because he has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business.
Peter hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a printer for printing photos.

loan.use: To buy a printer for printing photos.

loan.name: Shokirchon

texts.en: Shokirchon is 42 years old, married and has four children. He is an honest person. He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for 17 years. He owns three heads of cattle and two heads of small livestock. His wife helps him in this business. Shokirchon is a hard-working person and built a house together with his family, but does not have enough funds to make repairs to it. He is requesting a loan in the sum of 8000 somoni to install windows and doors, to make repairs and for other necessary supplies. Obtaining this loan will help his family budget.

loan.use: to make repairs to his house

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 61-year-old married woman. She has 10 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 39 years. She describes herself as quiet and likes to share ideas. She operates a stall where she sells bananas, mangoes, sugar cane, cassava and others. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy shopping centre.
Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to add stock of cassava, sugar cane and other fruit. Her business goal is to grow her business into wholesale within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her last-born child at the university.

loan.use: To buy cassava and sugar cane.

loan.name: Xayyam

texts.ru: Xayyam uje 5 let kak imeyet svoy magazin dlya prodaji produktov. On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji, do etogo on prodoval tolko pishiviye produkti no seychas on xochet prodovat tak je i ne pisheviye tak kak v etom yest potrebnost sredi pokupateley. On jenat no ne imeyet detey. Xayyam 41 qod. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Araz Dilagarda vmeste so svoyey jenoy.
texts.en: Xayyam has owned a store, where he sells products, for five years. He needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning supplies for sale. Up to now, he only sold food products, but now wants to also sell non-food products because he there is demand among his customers. He is married, but does not have children. Xayyam is 41 years old. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Araz Dilagarda village of the Fuzuli region together with his wife.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for sale

loan.name: Carey

texts.en:
Carey is a single man. He has been practicing dairy farming for three years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and his living standard.
In the future, Carey hopes to expand his farm into one that is large scale for more milk production. He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow.

loan.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loan.name: Shah Begum's Group

texts.en:
Shah begum is married and her husband is 46 years old. He operates a soft drink corner in the market where he sells Dodh soda" (made with milk and Sprite). His drink is very famous among his customers and they love to come to him due to its freshness and chillness.
Shah begum is also very skilled. She sews clothes and does decorative embroidery work. She learned this art from her mother before she got married. Now she earns good income from her skills which allows her to pay the utilities.
She has given birth to four sons; three of them are married while her youngest son is in 7th grade.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husbands business. With the loan, he will buy milk, sugar and bottles of Sprite in larger quantity to provide better quality drink to his customers and increase his sales.
He has been operating his business for many years and Shah begum is confident that an investment will help him increase his profits.

loan.use: to buy milk, sugar and bottles of Sprite for making "Dodh soda"

loan.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She has six children, four of which currently attend school. Her husband works as a driver. Dorcas operates a poultry business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years and was previously employed as a shop worker. Her primary customers are butchers and restaurants. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation. Her largest monthly expense is food.
Dorcas will use the loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to rebuild her chicken coop and buy more chicken feed. Dorcas aspires to have several bigger chicken coops in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital.

loan.use: to rebuild her chicken coop and buy more chicken feed.

loan.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is a resident of the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She is a married mother of two, aged 6 and 3. She has been in mixed farming for five years, producing and selling vegetables and milk to the local market. She also runs a retail shop business for additional income.
Caren has made a loan request of 52,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the purchase will improve her farming income and enable her to educate her children.She aspires to be a large-scale farmer.
She says occasional droughts is a challenge to farming in the area.

loan.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a businesswoman who sells cereals such as maize and beans. She has been in the business for eleven years and has employed two people. She also sells clothes to supplement her income. She has been able to boost her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.
Jane dreams of expanding her business into wholesale in the future. She has requested a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy cereals.

loan.use: to buy cereals.

loan.name: Kindet Ole Kipiriro

texts.en:
Kindet is 29 years old and now married with two children. He is still practicing farming and getting god returns.
He is currently applying for his second loan, which he will use to buy more farm supplies like pesticides, seedlings and farming equipment for the next planting season. He serviced his previous loan well and he was able to repay his loan well and on time. He plans to use the profits from this current loan to ensure that his farm has a continuous harvest and is well taken care of.
He is an honest man who has plans to see himself continuing to prosper with his farm produce and grow to large scale farming in the future.

loan.use: to buy more farm supplies

loan.name: Lesiamon

texts.en:
Lesiamon is a 32-year-old married man and a father to three children. He has been a farmer for the past three years.
Lesiamon is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd after he repaid his previous loan well. He plans to use this loan to buy farm supplies like pesticides and seedlings and pay for the labor on his farm so that he can prepare for the next planting season. With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest the remaining amount in farming.
He dreams of becoming a well-known farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more albeit limited resources.

loan.use: to buy farm supplies

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy one bale of pagnes and four rolls of fabric

loan.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 53 years old and widowed with one child. To earn a living, she has been practicing dairy farming for over 20 years. She has employed one person to assist her in the business. She also owns rental houses, which earn her extra income.
Ann has managed to improve her business since she joined Faulu Kenya. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she was trained on business management skills. She has requested a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loan.use: To buy a dairy cow

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy farm inputs

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has two children: a 4-year-old boy and a 2 year-old girl. Theyre both currently enrolled in school. Josephine owns a rental house as well as a vegetable stand, selling her goods from home. She's worked in this business for two years. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She says her greatest business challenge is seasonality and her largest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills, and school fees.
Josephine will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy cement, stones and other supplies to construct a new rental house. Josephine hopes to add more rooms to her rental house in the future. She joined Yehu to improve her business and her family's standard of living.

loan.use: to buy cement, stones and other supplies to construct a new rental house.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a saloon car for taxi operation

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase new equipment and tools

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph used his previous loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes. With the increased stock of shoes, he was able to attract more customers to his business and earn more income. He has grown his business and he has employed two people in his business. Joseph has requested another loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy shoes.

loan.use: To buy shoes to sell

loan.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Phillip has been a farmer for the last eight years. He is 34 years old and married.
He is client who has been with KADET for a while. This is his third loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farm supplies (pesticides and seedlings) and to buy livestock for fattening. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.
His dream is to be the best and most wel known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loan.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock

loan.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is from Iraq. He is 25 years old, married, and a father of one child.
Hani has had a workshop since 2009 for cars, plumbing, and painting. He has good experience in this field, a good reputation, and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.
He is requesting a $1,500 loan in order to purchase a generator and to make a sliding door. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his familys life.

loan.use: to purchase a generator and to make a sliding door.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to stock up on merchandise such as palm oil for resale

loan.name: Ologolimot

texts.en:
Ologolimot is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He does mixed farming where he rears livestock and does wheat farming. He has been doing this for the past five years.
He learned about KADET from the KADET staff. He is currently applying for his third loan after he repaid his previous loans well. He plans to spend part of the proceeds on his wheat farm and the remainder to purchase more sheep and goats for fattening.
He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children. He dreams to expand his farm.

loan.use: to plant on his farm and buy more livestock.

loan.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and the father of two children.
Mohamad has owned a shop since 2004, selling mobile phones and accessories. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area where a lot of potential customers pass by.
He decided to apply for a $2,000 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loan.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop and to add more stock.

loan.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a 34 year old businessman who is married. His wife is a housewife and they are blessed with two children. He has been a hawker for the past year with a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Elijah will use the loan to buy belts, watches and albums for selling. With the anticipated profit he hopes to save for the education of his children.
He hopes to open a retail shop and improve the living standards of his family.

loan.use: to buy belts, watches, and albums for selling.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a hardworking businesswoman, age 46. She is married and blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. For the last year, she has been rearing goats to support her family. In the next five years, she wants to practice dairy farming. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more goats.

loan.use: to buy goats.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more stock of goods

loan.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and the father of four children.
Hussein has owned a shop since 2005, selling frozen meat. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a lot customers passing by him.
He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to repair and fix his shops walls and floors. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loan.use: to repair and fix his shops walls and floors.

loan.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She has been selling used clothes for the last year to make a living. She has employed one person to help her to run the business. Gladys is able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to manage a wholesale business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy used clothes for resale.

loan.use: to buy used clothes.

loan.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 35 years old, married to Antony. They have two children who go to school. She runs a retail shop where she has been selling assorted household goods for the last four years for a monthly profit of KES. 30,000.
She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale.
With the anticipated profits, she will pay school fees for her children and save.

loan.use: to buy mattresses, source pans, and slippers for sale

loan.name: Abduorif

texts.en: Abduorif is married and has one daughter. He has made a living for the past ten years by breeding, fattening and selling large cattle. It's profitable, but prices are constantly changing and rising, hence Abduorif is asking for a loan in order to buy two tonnes of animal fodder. He's hoping to receive the loan and stock up enough feed to last the winter.
